people.aboutText: Ha Seung-Jin (born August 4, 1985) is a South Korean professional basketball player who has played in the NBA and the NBA D-League. He was a second round draft pick (46th overall) of the Portland Trail Blazers in the 2004 NBA Draft.

people.name: Antonio Valencia
people.aboutText:
Luis Antonio Valencia Mosquera, commonly known as Antonio Valencia (Spanish pronunciation: [anˈtonjo βaˈlensja]; born 4 August 1985), is an Ecuadorian professional footballer who plays as a right winger and right-back for Manchester United and the Ecuador national team.
After progressing through the youth system at El Nacional, Valencia became a first team regular and made over 80 appearances for the club before signing for La Liga side Villarreal in 2005. He only made two league appearances for the Spanish side in between successful loan spells at Recreativo de Huelva for the 2005–06 season and later English Premier League club Wigan Athletic from 2006 to 2008.

people.name: Nick Augusto
people.aboutText: Leon Stuart Camier (born 4 August 1986) is a British motorcycle racer. He was the 2005 British Supersport and 2009 British Superbike Champion. 2010 was his first season in the World Superbike series.

people.name: Leon Camier
people.aboutText: Nick Augusto (born August 4, 1986) is an American drummer, best known as the former drummer of heavy metal band Trivium, in which he played from 2009 until 2014.

people.name: Cicinho
people.aboutText: David Williams (born 4 August 1986) is an Australian professional rugby league footballer for the Manly-Warringah Sea Eagles of the National Rugby League. A New South Wales State of Origin and Australia international representative winger, he has played his entire professional career to date with the Sea Eagles, having won the 2008 NRL Premiership with them. He is the younger brother of former Parramatta, Sydney Roosters, Nth Qld and Cronulla winger, John Williams.

people.name: David Williams
people.aboutText: Alex Sandro Mendonça dos Santos (born 4 August 1986), commonly known as Cicinho, is a Brazilian footballer who plays for Bahia as a right back.

people.name: Jang Keun-suk
people.aboutText: Marreese Akeem Speights (born August 4, 1987) is an American professional basketball player for the Golden State Warriors of the National Basketball Association (NBA). Speights played college basketball for the University of Florida, where he was a freshman member of the Florida Gators' NCAA national championship team in 2007.

people.name: Marreese Speights
people.aboutText: Jang Keun-suk (Hangul: 장근석; hanja: 張根碩; born August 4, 1987) is a South Korean actor and singer.

people.name: Tomoya Warabino
people.aboutText: Philip James "Phil" Younghusband (born 4 August 1987) is a Filipino international footballer.

people.name: Phil Younghusband
people.aboutText:
Tomoya Warabino (蕨野 友也, Warabino Tomoya, born August 4, 1987, in Miyakonojō, Miyazaki Prefecture, Japan) is a Japanese actor who is represented by the talent agency, A-Team.
^ "A-Team official website".

people.name: Carly Foulkes
people.aboutText: Kelley Maureen O'Hara (born August 4, 1988) is a FIFA Women's World Cup champion and Olympic soccer gold medalist who plays as a wingback and midfielder for the United States Women's National Soccer Team and a forward for National Women's Soccer League club Sky Blue FC. As a forward for the Stanford women's soccer team, she was the recipient of the 2009 Hermann Trophy. In the history of the United States under-20 team, she is tied as the all-time third leading scorer and is sixth in number of caps played.

people.name: Kelley O'Hara
people.aboutText: Carly Foulkes (born August 4, 1988), also known colloquially as The T-Mobile Girl, is a Canadian model and actress who became known for appearing in a series of T-Mobile myTouch 4G television commercials, in which she often wore pink/magenta-and-white summer dresses. She continued as spokeswoman in other T-Mobile ads in which she was depicted as a pink-and-black leather-clad biker girl. She served as the T-Mobile spokesman primarily from fall 2010 until spring 2013, with occasional appearances since then.

people.name: Wang Hao
people.aboutText: Jessica Hilda Mauboy (born 4 August 1989) is an Australian R&B and pop singer, songwriter, and actress. In 2006, Mauboy was the runner-up on the fourth season of Australian Idol; she had auditioned for the talent show in Alice Springs, Northern Territory to pursue a recording career. Mauboy subsequently signed a contract with Sony Music Australia.

people.name: Jessica Mauboy
people.aboutText:
Wang Hao (Chinese: 王皓; pinyin: Wáng Hào; born August 4, 1989 in Harbin) is a Chinese chess Grandmaster. In November 2009, Wang became the fourth Chinese player to break through the 2700 Elo rating mark.
He has assisted in preparing Levon Aronian for the 2011 Candidate Matches.

people.name: Hikmet Balioğlu
people.aboutText: Siim Tenno (born 4 August 1990) is an Estonian international footballer who plays for Tammeka Tartu, as a midfielder.

people.name: Siim Tenno
people.aboutText: Hikmet Balioğlu (born 4 August 1990) is a Turkish footballer who plays as a centre-back for Şanlıurfaspor.

people.name: Thiago Cardoso
people.aboutText:
Thiago Cardoso (born 4 August 1991) is a Brazilian footballer who plays for Brazilian Serie C club Madureira.
^ "Wendel marca o gol do título para a Seleção Sub-19". Clube Atlético Mineiro (in Portuguese).

people.name: Neil Coleta
people.aboutText: Neil Mañosca Coleta (born 4 August 1991) is a Filipino actor.

people.name: Lucinda Dryzek
people.aboutText: Lucinda "Lucy" Dryzek (born 4 August 1991) is an English actress, known for playing Katy Riley in the BBC sitcom Life of Riley.

people.name: Izet Hajrović
people.aboutText: Izet Hajrović (born 4 August 1991) is a Bosnian professional footballer who plays as a winger for Spanish club Eibar on loan from German club Werder Bremen and the Bosnia and Herzegovina national team.

people.name: River Viiperi
people.aboutText: Tiffany Evans (born August 4, 1992) is an American singer, songwriter, actress, dancer and entrepreneur. Evans rose to fame in 2003 as a contestant on "Star Search," hosted by Arsenio Hall. The pint-sized singer, with a magnificent voice, snagged the title of Grand Champion in the junior singer division.

people.name: Tiffany Evans
people.aboutText: River Delfín Canomanuel Viiperi (born 4 August 1991) is a Spanish model. He has been in several advertising campaigns, including those for American Eagle, Bershka, Calvin Klein, Armani Exchange and Versace for H&M. He used to be Paris Hilton's boyfriend from 2012 to 2014.

people.name: Yvonne Neuwirth
people.aboutText:
Saido Berahino (born 4 August 1993) is an Anglo-Burundian professional footballer who plays as a forward for West Bromwich Albion.
Having fled his native Burundi as a child, he received political asylum in Birmingham, where he claimed that his interest in football helped him integrate into English society. Berahino joined West Bromwich Albion at the age of 11 and turned professional seven years later.

people.name: Saido Berahino
people.aboutText:
Yvonne Neuwirth (born 4 August 1992) is an Austrian tennis player.
Neuwirth has won one singles and one doubles title on the ITF tour in her career. On 14 July 2014, she reached her best singles ranking of world number 305.

people.name: Mayuko Fukuda
people.aboutText: Mayuko Fukuda (福田 麻由子, Fukuda Mayuko), born on August 4, 1994 in Tokyo, Japan, is a Japanese actress who made her debut in 1998. She is contracted to talent agency FLaMme.

people.name: Bobby Shmurda
people.aboutText: Ackquille Jean Pollard (born August 4, 1994 in Florida), known by his stage name Bobby Shmurda, is an American rapper from Brooklyn, New York, signed to Epic Records. He is best known for his song "Hot Nigga", (released in July 2014) a song that debuted the "Shmoney dance," which went viral after the release of the music video. This song peaked at 6 on the Billboard Hot 100, with the song being remixed and performed by numerous other artists including Lil' Kim, French Montana, Juicy J, and Gunplay.

people.name: Bruna Marquezine
people.aboutText: Jessica Elizabeth Sanchez (born August 4, 1995) is an American singer and songwriter originally from Chula Vista, California. She was the runner-up on the eleventh season of the reality show American Idol, and is currently signed to 19 Recordings and Interscope Records. Prior to appearing on American Idol, Sanchez competed in the first season of America's Got Talent at the age of 11.

people.name: Jessica Sanchez
people.aboutText: Bruna Reis Maia (born 4 August 1995 in Duque de Caxias, Rio de Janeiro), known as Bruna Marquezine, is a Brazilian actress and model. She began her career at the age of five after being discovered by director Cininha de Paula and was invited to attend the soap opera Mulheres Apaixonadas where the young girl played the sweet Salette. Since then Bruna became known nationally.

people.name: Ekaterina Ryabova
people.aboutText: Ekaterina Dmitrievna "Katya" Ryabova (Russian: Екатерина Дмитриевна "Катя" Рябова, born 4 August 1997) is a Russian singer.

people.name: Seishiro Kato
people.aboutText:
Seishiro Kato (加藤 清史郎, Katō Seishirō, born August 4, 2001 in Kanagawa Prefecture) is a Japanese child actor.
He debuted when he was 13 months old. He became recognized after his breakthrough role as Higuchi Yoroku (childhood name of Naoe Kanetsugu, as well as Kanetsugu's first son, Takematsu) in Tenchijin the 2009 edition of NHK Taiga Drama.
